alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 12:28PM MST until January 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches in the lower elevations, with 18 to 24 inches possible over mountain tops and high ridges. * WHERE...Much of Carbon County including Baggs, Saratoga, Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Medicine Bow, Elk Mountain, and Arlington. The highest amounts are expected over the Ferris, Seminoe, and Shirley Mountains as well as the foothills of the Sierra Madre Range south of Rawlins. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation will be hazardous and may be life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers can become disoriented in near whiteout conditions, and could become lost or stranded.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
